results.headline: Review: In ‘Shaun the Sheep Movie,’ a Flock Heads to the City to Find Its Farmer
results.summary_short: In this stop-motion animation film, from the studio that made “Wallace & Gromit,” the sheep run into trouble in their urban adventure.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shaun the Sheep Movie

results.headline: Review: ‘Two Step’ Scuffles Around With Petty Criminals
results.summary_short: Alex R. Johnson’s feature-length debut is a nasty, well-acted little gem that goes deep inside its characters’ psyches.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Two Step

results.headline: Review: ‘The End of the Tour’ Offers a Tale of Two Davids
results.summary_short: The movie presents a lifelike picture of its subject, David Foster Wallace, although Wallace is not really its subject at all.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The End of the Tour

results.headline: Review: From Israel, ‘The Kindergarten Teacher,’ a Drama About Poetry and Obsession
results.summary_short: In Nadav Lapid’s film, an experienced teacher wants to help a 5-year-old boy who shows a remarkable gift for poetry, but she may not know when to stop.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Kindergarten Teacher

results.headline: Review: ‘Wild City’ Follows Two (Very) Good Samaritans in Hong Kong
results.summary_short: This movie, directed by Ringo Lam, features a former cop and his cab-driving stepbrother who take extravagant risks in protecting a woman from triad gangsters.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wild City

results.headline: Review: ‘Paulo Coelho’s Best Story’ Hopscotches Through an Author’s Career
results.summary_short: This Brazilian film depicts Mr. Coelho’s rebellious youth, setbacks, grand adventures and literary success.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Paulo Coelho's Best Story

results.headline: Review: ‘Mission: Impossible — Rogue Nation’ With Tom Cruise and Plenty of Stunts
results.summary_short: For the fifth “Mission: Impossible” movie, Mr. Cruise is joined by, among others, Jeremy Renner, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg and Rebecca Ferguson.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation

results.headline: Review: ‘Jenny’s Wedding,’ a Lecture on Tolerance
results.summary_short: This movie, directed by Mary Agnes Donoghue and starring Katherine Heigl as a closeted lesbian, is about secrets, lies and bigotry.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jenny's Wedding

results.headline: Review: In ‘That Sugar Film,’ a Bitter Truth
results.summary_short: For this documentary, the director and actor Damon Gameau subjects himself to a high sugar diet, by way of juice, yogurt and cereal.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of That Sugar Film

results.headline: Review: In ‘Dark Awakening,’ a Haunted House and Surfeit of Gore
results.summary_short: Dean C. Jones’s film depicts a small-town prosecutor who moves with his family into his deceased mother’s house, only to be pestered by its spectral residents.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dark Awakening

results.headline: Review: In ‘A Lego Brickumentary,’ Master Builders Working and Playing
results.summary_short: A movie explores the uses, from artistic to therapeutic, of a ubiquitous toy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A LEGO Brickumentary

results.headline: Review: ‘I Am Chris Farley,’ a Brief Life, Lived for Laughs
results.summary_short: In this documentary about the comedian, colleagues recall Mr. Farley’s exuberantly physical humor and invented characters, including the motivational speaker who lived “in a van down by the river.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Am Chris Farley

results.headline: Review: ‘Counting,’ a Meditation in Story Shards
results.summary_short: Jem Cohen turns out to be a type of space-age traveler, if one who’s crossing cinematic time.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Counting

results.headline: Review: ‘Best of Enemies’ Recalls Gore Vidal and William F. Buckley Jr.’s TV Battles
results.summary_short: This documentary from Robert Gordon and Morgan Neville mines the Buckley-Vidal skirmishes around the 1968 political conventions for nuggets of historical insight.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Best of Enemies

results.headline: Review: In ‘Vacation,’ Christina Applegate and Ed Helms Travel to Walley World
results.summary_short: This comedy about a family’s theme park journey is a sequel to “National Lampoon’s Vacation,” the 1983 Chevy Chase film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Vacation

results.headline: Review: ‘Listen to Me Marlon’ Explores Brando’s Life of Contention
results.summary_short: The documentary “Listen to Me Marlon,” directed by Stevan Riley, draws on audio recordings in which the actor talked about his life and career.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Listen to Me Marlon

results.headline: Review: ‘Horse Money,’ a Surreal Voyage Into the Past
results.summary_short: In Pedro Costa’s fantastical Portuguese film, a man passes through an abyss and finds himself in a hospital confronting specters from his younger days.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Horse Money

results.headline: Review: ‘Five Star’ Casts a Cool Eye on Gang Culture
results.summary_short: This documentary-fiction hybrid from Keith Miller looks at the softness that threatens hard-guy hierarchies.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Five Star

results.headline: Review: ‘Unexpected,’ a Tale of 2 Pregnancies That Unite and Divide
results.summary_short: Kris Swanberg’s film depicts a Chicago schoolteacher who discovers that she is pregnant just as one of her top students does, and peppers her protégée with advice.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Unexpected

results.headline: Review: ‘The Young Kieslowski’ Is a Sobering Comedy of Consequences
results.summary_short: Two college students, a first sexual encounter and one pregnancy — with twins — in this uncomfortable comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Young Kieslowski
